text: The third branch was called the Tigris2:14. “Tigris”: literally “Hiddekel,” thought to be the old Hebrew name for the Tigris. See also Daniel 10:4. and it flowed east of the city of Asshur. The fourth branch was called the Euphrates.2:14. “Euphrates”: literally “Parat,” usually thought to be synonymous with the Euphrates.
